Reviews.Title: “If you like unknown 'fragrances'”
Reviews.Author: whereismyorange
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights. I don't suggest the single room on the first floor as it smelled like someone was smoking non-stop for weeks (non-smoking room...). You are also able to hear everything from the room next door because of the paper thin walls.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: fazak
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 5 days at this hotel. It's near a tram line that has frequent trams running through it to and from the main centraal station. Along the way you can hop off at Dam square to visit the red light district or at keizergrast to watch a movie at Pathe cinema. The breakfast was simple & included your usual coffee, tea, juice, cereal,oats, toast & boiled eggs. Fruits are also available. The rooms were also clean & most important a working elevator! LOL!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Wifi”
Reviews.Author: Kangalama
Reviews.Content: The room was small (as to be expected in Amsterdam) but was sufficient and clean. Wifi access was free but worked poorly, sometimes the network was not accessible at all. Therefore the hotel is not that well suited for business travellers who need to check e-mail. It was easy to reach the place by tram from the central train station.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: BingobingoMarburg
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in this small and friendly hotel. Very good prices, friendly people, nice rooms. My recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Good Location Stayed September 2011”
Reviews.Author: Rogersmax1
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel and good location, Staff where very pleasant and helpful This hotel features a lift which is rare in Amsterdam as you would not want to navigate the spiral stairs. Room was comfortable although not very large it was adequate and good bathroom facilities. Breakfast was continental with a fair choice of meats cheese and fruit. Easy to get to by tram 25 and 4 and not far from the heineken expieriance. We stayed 3 days and it is better to buy a ticket to cover the longer period we bought by the day which was not cheap. Museams are expensive so if you want to visit get a multi ticket if you like culture, dam square busling , popular, rembrandt square is a nicer option and enjoyed a couple of nice meals in the restuarants. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and welcoming place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AyeletAA
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect for us. It was quite and close to the museums we intend to go, Leidesplein area and the Market. Also a supermarket is very close by (other side of the the canal) where we find good products just before coming back. Breakfast was good and the atmosphere was quite and welcoming. The standard room was very tiny and with simple furnitures but the shower and toilet part was wide and comfortable. The transportation was very good- Tram 4 and 25 and some other lines - 100 meter from the hotel. We certainly recommend - but take the larger room even if you have to pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Fair and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: aviralj
Reviews.Content: Great location - next to tram stop. Small but very clean and decent hotel. Very well maintained interiors though the room is tiny. Nice breakfast. Centrally located to see Amsterdam and at the same time the hotel lane is calm and next to a canal - nice to walk around! Recommend for city tour stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value (and especially for RAI visitors)”
Reviews.Author: annu1234
Reviews.Content: Location If you are visiting the RAI conference center, the location is probably one the best with a stop for tram 4 just in front of the hotel; and Leidseplein and Rembrantplein are about 10-15 min walk from the hotel. (In some older maps the tram route for number 4 is outdated, but it is correct in the google maps.) There are also many restaurants already on the way to Rembrantplein. Easy access to the old city center etc. by tram as well. The location is also quite good for those who prefer quiet good night sleep without noise from a bar downstairs and reasonable walking/tram distance to places. If you want to be a bit closer to Leidseplein but still in a quiet area, for example the museum area might be even just slightly better location for you, for example Bilderberg Hotel. Hotel The breakfast was good and was included in the price, which seems to be rare. I donâ€™t remember seeing it in our reservation form via hotels.nl, but the Wi-Fi was free as well; the codes are in the hotel book in the room. There were some problems with the connection at about 10 am in several mornings, but since we originally thought we would need to pay extra for the connection, this did not bother us too much. Otherwise the hotel was small, beautiful and very fresh with good new beds, elevator and a doorman during the nighttime. Our room was a bit warm during the daytime even though it was only about 20 C outside, but you can open the large windows. Other CafÃ© Kale just across the street served excellent simple meals. There are plenty of lower-quality tourist-trap steakhouses in the busier areas. Few blocks south from the hotel is the bazaar area with some tourist-stuff but you can also get some freshly fried waffles there. All in all I would recommend this place and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A very clean and nice small hotel located in a quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Visit0r111
Reviews.Content: A very nice staff was willing to help with tips and advice all the time Rooms were very clean. The triple room had a good light and space. In the double room not much of a view The location is amazing we were able to arrive by foot almost to every place in Amsterdam and it is also close to public transportation (trams and boat) Itâ€™s a residential reach and calm neighborhood far from the noisy dirty area of Central station

Reviews.Title: “Small room but spotlessly clean with comfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: Mandy159
Reviews.Content: Our "deluxe" room was TINY but it had a nice carpet, good bed, comfortable pillows and good double glazing that cut out all noise from outside. The bathroom had a full size bath with overbath shower, toilet and washbasin. Again, very small but a good use of available space and lots of very HOT water even at peak times so we had great showers. Just a handtowel and bathtowel each and some basic bath products but these were restocked. The staff were helpful and friendly and the breakfasts (included in our room rate) included fresh fruit, a selection of breads/crackers/crispbreads, cheeses, cold meats, hard boiled eggs, cereal, juices, tea or coffee. We ate well and would return to this hotel in the future. Trams 4 and 25 take you to Dam Square and/ or Central Station and nearby is a massive street market and a short walk to the museums, the Heineken experience and Vondel Park.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Yatri9
Reviews.Content: 1. Hotel well located. You are actually within 5 to 10 minutes of all important sites. 2. Reception is warm and helpful. 3.Not a great Breakfast .... 4. No electric kettle in rooms. 5. Toiletries meagre . 6. There is no security locker in rooms. You have to store your valuables in safe deposit lockers and pay for the key and keep a deposit with the hotel. 7. Please read instructions carefully when and if you do stay at the hotel. 8. Hotel does not provide any umbrellas if it rains. Normally several hotels provide umbrellas free of charge. 7.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LeneRud
Reviews.Content: We spent af very nice holyday i Amsterdam in june 2011, and we lived at Hotel Nicolaas Witsen. The hotel is situated very well, outside the center of the city in quiet surroundings, but near enough to walk to city along the canals in small streets. Is is situated near the museumsquater (15 minutes of walking). The room was fine, clean and with good furnitures. The beds were good. The bathroom was rather small, but fine and new and everything was well functioning. Big new windows to the street gave lot of light into the room. The windows were easy to open to let ind fresh air.Black and white curtins to regulate the sun in the room. The breakfast was well with what you normally need. The staff were kind and helpfull. The whole atmosphere at the hotel was relaxed and unformal. We can recommend this hotel for tourists who want to live in the city but also want quiet nights and fesh air, and who want to spent some time at the wonderfull artmuseums in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: karen2864
Reviews.Content: We only wanted a place to serve as a base. Well I picked the right place as we loved it here. Even the basics were high standard. Pleny of storage space(wardrobes and drawers). A tv and a beautiful shower/toilet. Beds comfortable and room cleaned everyday even without asking. The housekeeper very trustworthy. The staff were always helpful. We have no disapointments with Nicolaas Witsen hotel or its staff and would have no hesitation in recommending them to anyone of our friends/family. In fact we have said when we go back to Amsterdam we want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Does the Job”
Reviews.Author: notonfacebook
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-placed for the big museums. The rooms are small but didn't feel like it. Hotel is pretty quiet but noisy neighbours were a slight problem. Staff friendly and helpful, continental breakfast was limited but not too much so.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in the heart of Amsterdam..”
Reviews.Author: Handet
Reviews.Content: Definitely a hidden gem in the heart of Amsterdam.. the hotel is located very strategically in a quiet residential part of Amsterdam and yet it is very close to all of the must-see and must-do things.. Tram station is only 5 min away from the hotel and you can easly walk to all attractions during the summer. Best part of the hotel is the staff, they are amazing and very helpfull. My trip to Amsterdam was disrupted by closures at London airport but the hotel staff was extremely helpful in accommodating my all last minute changes in my reservation. And when we finally made our way to Amsterdam, they were very quick with all our requests and provided very good insights about Amsterdam. The rooms are small compared to hotel rooms in North America but then this is the norm in Europe so I would not complain. For me, most important thing was the cleanness of the hotel and I was very impressed with the day-to-day cleaning of the hotel. The breakfast was good and enough for a good start to the day.. Plus it is not really easy to find a hotel in Amsterdam to provides breakfast and free wi-fi. In short, you get a great value for your money given the great service, staff and location of Nicolaas Witsen. I would for sure plan another trip to Amsterdam this time in summer and stay at this hotel again, and would recommend it to everyone who is looking for a budget friendly and comfortable stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value & staff were so helpfull”
Reviews.Author: travelbugno1
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel in the start of jan2010, hotel was close by tram and minutes from the city center, staff were very helpfull, room was lovely, very clean and spacious!! would recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming hotel staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: mehoua28
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice, the rooms were clean and cosy and the location is great. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: fraz13r
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review, the location of this hotel makes up for the average room amenities. Most small private hotels in Amsterdam all tend to be small and 'quant'. This is edges them out a little bit on price, location & free internet. It's only about a 5 minute walk to Leidseplein plaza, and a lot of that is along a beautiful part of the canals. Additionally, it's right next to a tram line which go straight into the city centre, but truth is that it's only about a 15 to 20 minute walk from this hotel, and much of that takes you past common city attractions. The room itself is average. Certainly a 'no-frills' hotel. It has free wireless internet in the room and that is a real bonus. Breakfast was light, but adequate and the coffee fresh & hot. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. In Summary, if you're the kind that don't plan to spend a lot of time in your room and are not looking for much then this is a good place. Good Location, friendly staff, free internet and a light breakfast makes for a good base to explore Amsterdam. If however you look to pamper yourself and like to enjoy a nice hotel room then perhaps you should consider one of the larger big-brand-name hotels

Reviews.Title: “Very clean with great customer service.”
Reviews.Author: hotazza
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed two nights at this hotel which I found via trip advisor. The place was very clean and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel was just oustide of the city centre with no more than a 15 minute walk to get you into the heart of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: gillsy
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights at the hotel in August. We were extremely disappointed with the room which was so small it was impossible for 2 people to pass the end of the bed at the same time. The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable but we were given a double bed when I had requested twin beds. There was no hairdryer or safe as stated in the hotel description. The breakfast was very basic - not even a toaster!! The waitress said lots of people ask for toast - so why doesnt the hotel invest in one......... The bread was delicious but there was a very poor selection of food- one type of cheese (out of a packet), ham, chicken, tomatoes and cucumber, 2 types of cereal and a few different jams. Oh yes and hard boiled gs - nothing cooked fresh or hot and not even croissants. I saw the manager go from handling room keys to picking up cheese from a packet to put out in the breakfast room without washing his hands or using gloves - uck! The staff were extremly friendly and helpful and are an asset to the hotel. The carpet on the stair was filthy and the handrail sticky with dirt. Both night we had disturbed sleep with returning guess at 2.30am and 4.30am. Perhaps the night doorman could have asked them to keep the noise down at such a late hour. Trams at the end of the road can also be heard in the rooms from 6am onwards. Prevoius reviewers have said the hotel is well located. It is certainly one of the nicer areas of Amsterdam but a good 15 minutes walk from most places - ok during the day but not so good at night. There are much better hotels better located and I would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional for the price...as long as you pack your earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: stickywicks
Reviews.Content: The service at The Nicolaas Witsen was fantastic. Staff were incredibly helpful and answered all my queries as best they could. The location was also extremely convenient and I'm glad I chose to stay near Museumplein rather than near Dam Square because it is a far nicer area and all the main attractions are easy to get to via the tram which is a 30 second walk from the hotel. My room was pretty small...it reminded me of a cabin on a boat...however I was travelling alone so this was more than adequate as I'm also rather small myself! I also chose the standard, single room so wasn't expecting a great deal. Everything was exceptionally clean and I made good use of the flat screen TV and free WiFi. To be honest it was great for the price. Few hotels in Amsterdam include flat screen TV, ensuite, WiFi, hotel with elevator and breakfast for such a low price. In fact I'm not sure if any do! My bed was lovely and comfy and I was extremely thankful to the staff for managing to source me an adaptor so that I could use my laptop and phone charger. My only issue with the room was the paper thin walls. I don't know if this was the same in all the rooms...but in room 38 it was definitely the case. I did not get a great deal of sleep during my stay at the Nicolaas Witsen due to being next door to a particularly 'rampant' German couple on the first night and a screaming new born on the second. I could hear it all as if it were happening in the room with me. Not overly nice. However...not really the fault of the hotel...and I shall definitely be packing ear plugs on future getaways! Overall...clean, comfortable and exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mike424u
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews on hotels in Amsterdam, it seems like they all have a fairly heavy price tag, for 3 and 4* and some terrible reviews. After many long hours of searching we picked this hotel. We thaught it was the best of a bad bunch in the 3* and 4* range. We were in for shock, the location couldnt have been better, the service, the room all checked out perfect. What a find, we could not fault this hotel in anyway, and this hotel offered contental breakfeast inculded which many others did not for the same sort of price. Great location 2 min to Tram stop, and just jump on tram No 4 either to central station, or station Rai. Hotel staff very helpfull with local maps etc. Double room with the most comfy bed we have ever come across. There is also a smal lift. Nice small bar area, and very close to local coffee house / pub. Tram stop at the end of the street. Nice 10- 15 min walk to Rembrant square. Also close to heinken brewery, flower market etc. Best find in a city we had never exsplored before, we will be going back to exsplore more in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and good value”
Reviews.Author: HST_10
Reviews.Content: The service in this comparatively small hotel was really, really good. At breakfast I never had to wait long to be served. The staff is very helpful and try to answer questions in all languages known to them. Considering the usual size of rooms in Amsterdam, the rooms of this hotel can be called rather big. The hotel is located between the city centre and the museum district, which makes it really convenient. On future trips to Amsterdam I will always book in the Nicolaas Witsen Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for sightseeing, comfortable, friendly hotel - very happy”
Reviews.Author: Queen_Elizabeth60
Reviews.Content: A good location is everything - this hotel is both quiet and very convenient to shopping areas, tourist areas - canals and art museums, and public transport - a top spot!

Reviews.Title: “Look forward to our visit”
Reviews.Author: floss41
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Nicholas Witsen at least once a year for several years now and are always assured of a warm welcome.We find the hotel clean and comfortable and always enjoy the continental breakfast and it's variety of different breads.the location is excellent with good tram links to town.we would strongly recommend this hotel.we have never found any members of staff unfriendly and unhelpful Mrs Noble,Brown and Ware

Reviews.Title: “very familiar and friendly environment”
Reviews.Author: ant0ni0c
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very clean, the location is perfect in a very quiet and charm street, close to everything; the staff very attentive and kind; and the breakfast superb. The best of all is the price very affordable!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel--- Lived up to all the good reviews I read”
Reviews.Author: papatet
Reviews.Content: Arrived after the eight hour flight from Detroit anxious to get the hotel at 8:30 am. After getting out of the airport we found that we were connected directly to the train station. Getting ahead of myself the directions the Hotel provided were not only easy to follow but very precise. We purchased a ticket to go to the main train station in Amsterdam. Note the ticket machines are all in Dutch and only take euro coins so if you plan on using them get directions on the internet before you leave. We bought ours from the ticket counter which was very easy and at this time of the morning not very busy. Everyone spoke English which is a big help when going to Europe. After getting to the train station a short ride on the #4 tram and then a two block walk and we were there. We explained that we knew we were early and would probably have to wait for our room. The young girl at the desk was very friendly and said she could hold our bags if we wanted to leave and the room would probably be ready in a hour or so. They have a free European breakfast every morning so we asked if we could have some juice and coffee and she said sure. The waitress was more than happy to serve us. While we were drinking our coffee the young girl came in and told us that they had finished cleaning our room and we could check in then. It was very nice and very clean.For the price it is it was more than what we were use too as we just need a clean room to sleep in because we are usually out enjoying the country and don,t spend too much time in the room..Could not find anything wrong with staying at this hotel. The LOCATION was also one of the reasons we stayed here. Within walking distance to almost everything you needed to see in Amsterdam.It was the RIGHT choice..

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: RobertoB1943
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Nicolaas Witsen in the begin of September for a bussines travel and I enjoyed my stay a lot. I get a warm welcome and everybody at the desk was very helpfull. The room was new and had a nice flat television on the wall. The breakfast was simple, but tastefull and more than enough. The hotel is in the city centre and all attractions you can walk. In December I will come back with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Xmas in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Tango01
Reviews.Content: I was positively surprised, taking into account the negative reviews I have encountered at the very beginning of my hotel quest. So, the positive points are: - Warm welcome, efficient frontdesk. - Nice comfy and simple but fully equipped rooms. - Good location. near both van gogh and modern art museum, near rembrantplatz. - Good restaurant recommendations. Negative: not too close to the train station, so might not be a good choice for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “7 days the same breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Mila3
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights in Amsterdam in the Nicolaas Witsen Hotel last september. The hotel is in a good position and the staff is quite nice. The rooms are very very small and the bathrooms also but they are very clean. The thing the bothered me the most was the breakfast: It is the same every single day! This might not be a problem if you are staying 1-2 days but for 7 days in a row .....it was to much! The same2-3 cheese and pastrami and 1 egg .........no option of choosing or changing.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this place if you want privacy and good service”
Reviews.Author: stargazer999
Reviews.Content: Read this if you're thinking about staying at this place, do not be fooled by the positive reviews because those people have probably never been to a decent hotel. Well first of all this is not a hotel. It's some people renting out low quality apartments at hotel rates but with no service and you don't even get a room key! Well you do get a key but you can only use it within the hotel premises. Incredibly stupid! So every time you leave the hotel you have to turn over the key to the front desk. And every time you get back to the hotel, tired or drunk or with someone that you want to spend the night with, you have to ring the bell and wait for one of the two very unpleasant night clerks to come and open the door for you. Wow, that's exactly how people want their nights in Amsterdam to end, with a frowning arab night clerk unlocking the door in slow motion....splendid No privacy. No service. The rooms are extremely basic, the furniture worn out and old, the carpet smelled really bad and the breakfast was disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Spot!”
Reviews.Author: voonda
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous reviews, we were pretty confident about staying here. You should be too.... Location... It is in a really good spot...on the right side of Dam Square. It's on a quiet but safe street. The trams are very near and very regular. we used to get the 16 or 25 (i think) from the other side of Dam at times when we were too tired, but it can be walked easily . It was about a 5/ 10 minute walk from Dam. No bothers. Just near the Heineken Brewery. The Hotel... The room was really clean, comfortable and spacious enough. We stayed in a triple room (Room 17). We were very happy with the bathroom everything was spotless and clean towels every day. Breakfast... Continental breakfast, oj, tea/coffee, boiled eggs, bread, jams, crackers. Good to keep you going 'til lunch.. Nightlife... Leidsplein, Cafe de Waard is good for music. The irish bar was alright, even though we sat outside. When the bars close at 1 a.m. ask any barman where Biblos is. It's just around the corner but make sure you go around the right corner. When Biblos closes at 3a.m. ask those barmen where Bourbon St. is. It's all great craic. All of the locals are really friendly and really know their languages. Can't wait to go back to Amsterdam and will definately stay here again! P.S. Make sure you go to Volendam and Marken to see windmills, cheese farm and clogs and a ferry ride with Lindburgh Excursions. Must do a canal ride as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: m_rowe
Reviews.Content: Being our first time in amsterdam, i think we picked the perfect hotel, in a great location just close enough to the centre, all the action of the centre was located 10-15 mins walk along one long road (and the heineken experience literaly around the corner) cutting out the need for public transport. the hotel was very well kept, the rooms were in imaculate condition and of a nice size. the staff were very freindly and helpfull, and breakfast was served quickly, to a high standard. A small selection of food and drinks were available at the bar, which were served around the clock which was a handy feature, if returning later on. I have no doubt that I will be staying with this hotel again and I recomend anyone in doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: PLomond
Reviews.Content: Previously in Amsterdam we have stayed close in near Central Station but this time went a little further out on good advice. This hotel is a straight line 10 minute stroll along an attractive canalside to Rembrandt Square - and from there 5 more minutes to city centre. The hotel staff are welcoming and helpful: our room was clean and fresh with a modern (if small) bathroom: the breakfast of egg, cheese, meats and lovely bread selection was excellent. It sits in a quiet street off a main artery. We took the Airport Connexxions bus to and from hotel - from airport it was a slow process as more people wanted the service than they had the capacity to provide; but return was on time and only 20 minutes to airport. If you have luggage this is the way to go - but if you can manage it, you are much better taking the train in from the airport to Central Station and then either the 4 or 25 tram to Freidrichsplein. The tram stops are just 50 metres from the hotel's street. If you want to avoid the noisy and overpriced centre for dinner, there are two local restaurants we would be happy to recommend to anyone. Thney are located about 200 metres along the main street (to the left) and sit close by each other. One is an Italian (live piano playing and owner occasionally sings!!) called La Storia Della Vita. The other a traditional Dutch called Van Aanderen which would be a wonderful choice for a special occasion dinner, a bit pricey but worth every cent for both food and extraordinary service and ambience. Reservations at both are recommended. Also close to the hotel (opposite the 25 tram stop) is a lovely cafe called Cafe Kale - like a tradional "brown cafe" which serves the most wonderful Apple Cake with coffee (and a full range of other snacks/meals and drinks). The young staff are as delightful as the fare they serve. My wife left a ring in the toilet and when we returned an hour later, they had it behind the bar for her. We were reminded this trip just how lovely Amsterdam can be when one avoids the crowds in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shirbaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nicolaas Witsen for 3 nights and found it to be a great little hotel. When you arrive in Amsterdam take the train from the airport to Amsterdam Central Station and then get the number 4 tram this stops at Fredrik Plein which is about 2 minutes from the hotel - really easy to find. The hotel is very clean and the staff really friendly. The room was small but comfortable, with a toilet and shower - very clean - the room also had a TV. There is a small bar which stays open till late. The breakfast consists of friut juice, tea and coffee a boiled egg and various bread and jams, cheese and ham - its just enough to get you through the morning. The hotel is in a very quiet street, however in the surrounding area of the hotel there are bars and restaurants and the hotel is 2 minutes from the canals. The hotel is extremely quiet you could hear a pin drop during the night - best nights sleep i've had in years! I would return to this hotel and recommed it to anyone wanting to visit this beautiful city, the hotel is in a great location - about 15 minute walk into the centre - with loads of bars, shops and restauarnts along the way. Visit the Heineken Brewary if you get the chance - its wonderful, costs 11 euro but you het 3 free drinks and a gift at the end (not telling you what it is but is useful!) the tour is great with loads of hands on things and great for the kids too. Amsterdam itself is lovely with loads of shops, its really clean and we didn't feel threatened at all and really easy to get round, take a boat trip for 7 euro it lasts an hour and you get to see loads of the lovely buildings, all in all a great place and well worth a visit - we shall return and stay again at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nicolaas Witsen Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: GeraldCharles
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything we were looking for. It was very clean and tidy, it was conveniently placed yet very peaceful. A short walk along the canals brought us to the city centre but several trams were also available. The Hotel Nicolaas Witsen staff were friendly and obliging and the price was sensible. The Connexxions Airport Shuttle (very reliable) delivered us to the hotel and returned us to the airport without any hassle. Within easy walking distance of the hotel we found several good eating places namely "Vamos a Ver" in Govert Flinckstraat, "Eetcafe" in the same street and "De Waaghals" vegetarian restaurant in Frans Halsstraat. The city itself is extremely interesting if a little dirty. There is a shortage of public conveniences and a few permanent city maps would have been useful. Thank you to the people of Amsterdam for your friendliness to these two senior citizens. Mr and Mrs W from Denmark April 2007

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Saabfan
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable with a very friendly and helpful staff. Our only intention was to sleep and this hotel was perfectly acceptable in that respect. If you're looking for luxury--look elsewhere. Our room was quite dorm-like. Exceptionally clean. Breakfast was basic but served quickly. A bit difficult to find as their website featured only driving directions. Check with the hotel for exact walking directions from the tram or be certain that your map has this small street labled.

Reviews.Title: “It Was Okay”
Reviews.Author: Rumaysa
Reviews.Content: it is very difficult to find this hotel and even the people who lives around it, dont know it! and the street where it is the hotel is not so nice like in the picture. the room is okey, is clean, tiny, has a nice bathroom, but the walls are very thin so you can listen almost everything and i think it isn t that close to the main places at least not walking, and you can get lost. the location is the problem but if you are traveling in a group maybe it wouldn t be!

Reviews.Title: “A good no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: LucyVic
Reviews.Content: We arrived early at the hotel (9am), aware that check in was at 2pm and were surprised and pleased that our room was ready for us. The room was quite basic and the bathroom was small, but everywhere was exceptionally clean. Breakfast consisted of boiled egg and a variety of bread - which was fine, but some fresh fruit would have been good. The hotel is a family run business, we found the staff pleasant and accommodating. The hotel is in a good location, 5 minute walk from the Rijksmuseum and Heinekein Eexperience (we recommend both) and a fifteen minute walk or a few minutes on the tram from the centre of Amsterdam. We throughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nicolaas Witsen Hotel”
Reviews.Author: QBA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrific, no hot water, no heating. Breakfast is not what you except from a 3 star hotel. If you want to stay somewhere decent avoid this at all cost

Reviews.Title: “Facilities decent, customer service nil”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One soft boiled egg and bread with a live worm in it is considered breakfast in the Netherlands, if I was thinking I should have taken a picture with my camera to post? Beware of the Arab night clerk who had a very nasty temperment and had no qualms showing it, in fact he was that way with my wife an international call. All of these incidents were reported to management to no avail. I've travelled extensively and received far superior treatment in third world countries.

Reviews.Title: “basic, clean, well located - decent value for money”
Reviews.Author: KirstyP
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a no-frills bed and breakfast hotel this won't see you far wrong. Within walking distance of city centre and a lot of attractions and museums.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Ange76
Reviews.Content: Having been slightly concerned by some of the negative comments on here I was quite apprehensive. I need not have worried. Good location and friendly, helpful staff. Perfectly pleasant breakfast, and clean rooms. We found no faults and enjoyed our stay. Good value for money considering the handy location.

Reviews.Title: “Charmless; not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: kateWashingtonDc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nicolaas Witsen for three nights and this trip confirmed my belief that there is a vast range of two-star hotels out there!! I thought 100 euros for a double room was excessive considering that this place was akin to a Motel 6. It was clean, with basic features, but it was utterly charmless. Breakfast - a couple pieces of Wonder Bread, a slice of cheese, and an egg - was served by surly waitresses who looked really annoyed to be working at the hotel. The rest of the staff wasn't much friendlier. The Nicolaas Witsen will do in a pinch, as it is fairly centrally located and clean, but you would be much better off trying to find a more interesting, charming place for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but lacking in ambience .”
Reviews.Author: CQuin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well priced given it's convenient location in the Museum district and it's close proximity to transport. We found the rooms small and smoky , but were told by the rather unfriendly staff that non smoking rooms did not exist. Bathroom was tiny and not very clean. Heating in the room had been disabled and was not available , staff (rather unfriendly!)told us that the cold season was over! Breakfast was OK. This would be a good place to stay if you are a smoker who is only looking for a bed to crash in and do not intend spending much time in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good bu!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this clean, friendly and convenient place. However, due to excessive external night noise, with the windows open for ventilation, and a high level of internal night noise it would be unfare to give a better rating than only 3 stars. During this stay the night noise was predictable as it came from guests who indicated a general disregard for other guests. I may have picked bad dates to stay it deserves a fourth star and I will try again. (once)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, Close to Attractions--”
Reviews.Author: commentmaker
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nigts on the internet--sight unseen. November 13,14, 2004. A bit difficult to find. Quiet, our room was at street level behind the reception area, clean, modern, all staff very polite and extremely helpful. Within walking distance to shops, museums, restaurants, casino, Hard Rock Cafe, and other attractions. Would recommend it. It is a small hotel with large hotel appeal.

Reviews.Title: “Totally fine”
Reviews.Author: melvinPickles
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I spent two days there in March 2004. It was perfectly fine. Nothing special, but no faults either. The room was clean and verged on attractive, really. The breakfast that was included was more than we could eat. The location is fine. It's really not far to anything from there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. We found it to be in the best possible location : close enough to the night life without being intrusive and near to many museums and other such places of interest. The room was small but very clean and the staff were helpful and friendly. However.......if you are not keen on lifts, beware of the stairs! We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you're not in your room very much!”
Reviews.Author: dustyroad52
Reviews.Content: The Nicolaas Witsen was not bad ... It's kind of modern and not in a bad location. Perhaps I just enjoy a different type of hotel (more cosy and smaller too). The staff were friendly and the breakfast was very good. So - there was nothing wrong with it, for the money it was good value.If you're not in your room overmuch it's not bad, it's just very small and rather plain, that's not a criticism per se just the facts.

Reviews.Title: “hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed here november 2003 ...very clean with pleasant staff who were very helpfull ...easy acces to everywhere .... will be going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in december 2003 it was clean and comfortable.it is in a quiet location but the main attractions are easily reached either by foot or tram.the staff are very friendly and helpful .

HotelInfo.Name: Nicolaas Witsen Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Nicolaas Witsenstraat 4-8, Amsterdam 1017 ZH , The Netherlands
